mods.note: Communications on this subject should be addressed to— The Under Secretary of State, Political Dept., India Office, London, S.W., and the following number quoted :— P. 381 >8529 Reference to previous correspondence f' Letter the India Office of the 5th Feb. |W2Q599.(^ INDIA OFFICE, 12th Feb 1916. Sir, 1 am directed by the Secretary of State for India to transmit to you, for the information of the Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs, copy of the papers noted below, on the subject of I am, Sir, Abu Musa. Your most obedient Servant, T. W. HOLDERNESS. The Under Secretary of State, FOREIGN OFFICE. Date of covering letter. Description. 7th Feb 1916 Telegram to Sir P. Cox. From Secretary of State to Sir P. Cox, Basra, ^ February 1916. ip ooii Your demi-official telegram dated 31st January. Abu Musa, loieign J Office would like German files. X 19546 I 1309 1000—10/l5LP 381] From Secretary of State to Sir P. Cox, Basra,' 1 February 1916. Your demi-official telegram dated 61st January. Abu Musa. location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: File 4919/1912 Pt 2 Abu Musa Oxide Concession: SOS telegram informing Sir P Cox that FO wish to have the German files seized at Bushire

physicalDescription.extent: The files are arranged chronologically from the front to the rear of the volume.

Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 5; these numbers are printed or written in pencil, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: Secretary of State telegram (7 February 1916) informing Percy Zachariah Cox, Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, that the Foreign Office would like the papers on the Abu Musa concession obtained from the German Consulate, Bushire.

name.namePart: Permanent Under-Secretary of State for India
Permanent Under-Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs
